abstract: Another large bank said it would write down the value of some of its assets, reigniting fears of a credit squeeze.
snippet: Another large bank said it would write down the value of some of its assets, reigniting fears of a credit squeeze.
lead_paragraph: Stocks declined sharply today after another large bank said that it would write down the value of some of its assets, reigniting fears of a credit squeeze, and technology stocks extended their losses. The Dow Jones industrial average plummeted more than 200 points, or 1.7 percent.

headline.main: Stocks Post Steep Losses, Capping Painful Week
